bimodal_explanation.hub_22x: Core separation steps (reflux) require high return ratio for purity
bimodal_explanation.spoke_8x: Auxiliary steps (feeding, takeoff) need less repetition

interpretation.max_350_meaning: Extreme reflux ratio for very high purity separation (>99.9%)
interpretation.a_vs_b: A-text (definitions) = column specs; B-text (procedures) = active separation protocols

DETAILED_INTERPRETATION:
REPETITION AS REFLUX_RATIO:

The bimodal repetition structure (hub 22.95x vs spoke 8.69x) maps to REFLUX_RATIO in Reflux Distillation / Azeotropic Systems.

BIMODAL DISTRIBUTION:
- Hub nodes (22.95x): Core separation steps (reflux) require high return ratio for purity
- Spoke nodes (8.69x): Auxiliary steps (feeding, takeoff) need less repetition

The 2.64x ratio between hub and spoke repetition reflects the difference between
primary processing (requiring many iterations) and auxiliary operations (fewer iterations).

MAXIMUM 350 MEANING:
The maximum repetition of 350 (for node 'k') represents: Extreme reflux ratio for very high purity separation (>99.9%)

This is consistent with 'k' being the most central node (centrality 4847) -
the primary action/state that everything passes through most often.

A-TEXT vs B-TEXT:
A-text (definitions) = column specs; B-text (procedures) = active separation protocols

A-text (9.23x mean): Contains specifications/definitions requiring fewer but more precise repetitions.
B-text (19.35x mean): Contains procedures/protocols requiring more iterative processing.
The 2.1x ratio (B/A) confirms B-text as operational content vs A-text as reference content.

EXTERNAL TERMINATION:
The absence of natural decay signal means the operator/system determines when processing is complete.
This matches Reflux Distillation / Azeotropic Systems where purity/quality is checked externally.
